bill.title: "Diabetes Care for Mississippi Students Act"; create to require schools to use Diabetes Management Care Plans for students with diabetes.
bill.description: An Act To Create The Diabetes Care For Mississippi Students Act; To Require Each School To Provide Effective Care In The School Setting For Students With Diabetes Through The Implementation Of Diabetes Medical Management Plans Effective With The School Year Beginning August 2019; Require The State Department Of Education And The State Department Of Health To Develop The Training Program And Guidelines To Be Used By School Nurses And Other Designated School Employees On Monitoring The Blood Glucose Levels Of Students Affected By Diabetes And Administering The Appropriate Care To Those Students; To Provide Personal And Civil Liability To Such Employees Under The Mississippi Tort Claims Act; To Require The Departments To Submit A Copy Of The Training Program And Guidelines To The Chairmen Of Certain House And Senate Legislative Committees On Or Before December 1, 2018; To Amend Sections 37-14-3 And 41-79-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.
